page.title: 18SHOPPING IN ST.HELIER
page.content: St.Helier is Jersey's main shopping centre, with over 530 shops in the block (78 of which are jewellers). The{shopping precinct}is a busy area, especially on Saturdays. There are 85 shops in King St.and Queen St., including 2 local department stores: Voisin & Co and De Gruchy & Co. Maison Le Riche sells Marks & Spencer's goods and several English chain stores have branches here eg.B.H.S., Woolworths, Boots, Etam, Manfield. Jewellery shops are the most common, followed by clothes and shoe shops. A band will sometimes play on Saturdays and there are pavement cafes in some of the side streets. The precinct is noticeably clean with litter bins at regular intervals. Features include reminders of the island's past: a granite apple crusher, Victorian signposts and a reconstruction of a wayside cross.
